intro: Erigeron montenegrinus, commonly known as the Montenegro fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region, particularly Montenegro. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are usually white to pale blue, with a fluffy appearance that attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erigeron montenegrinus is often found in open woodlands and alpine meadows, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
